content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
using Markdown

"""
    extract_julia_code(md) -> String

Extracts all Julia code blocks from a markdown document and joins them together with a newline.
"""
function extract_julia_code(md)
    # Parse the markdown document into an AST
    ast = parse_md(md)
    
    # Extract all code blocks from the AST
    code_blocks = [c.code for c in ast.content if isa(c, CodeBlock) && c.language == "julia"]
    
    # Remove code fences and join the code blocks together with a newline
    julia_code = join([strip(c) for c in code_blocks], "\n")
    
    return julia_code
end
```

Please note that this function assumes that the `language` field in the code block is set to "julia" to identify Julia code blocks. Also, the `strip` function is used to remove any leading or trailing whitespace from the code blocks.
